column1: An oscillatory secondary bifurcation for  magnetoconvection and
rotating convection at small aspect ratio
Department of Applied Maths and Theoretical Physics
We consider the dynamics of convection in a strong vertical magnetic

column2: and in the presence of rapid rotation. In both these cases

column1: in circumstances which can be realised in the laboratory
convection is in the form of tall thin cells. Because of this
dynamics near onset is characterised by an interaction between the
cellular modes and the horizontally averaged temperature profile. The
effects on the dynamics are slight in the case of a Boussinesq fluid.
convection can lose stability to oscillations close to onset.
